entry.title: Cactus Flowers
entry.content:
cactus flowers are the
brightest colors in the
desert

as far as my
human eye
can see

all though I do
suppose there might
be others

that can only
be seen by
a bee

entry.title: Buffalo Wool
entry.content:
while walking in the mountains
after the last snow of the season
we see buffalo wool strewn about the meadows

eventually
we find the great beings themselves
one of them rolling in a dust bath
freeing itself of its winter coat

they watch us as we pass
giving them a wide berth
for we are small and weak in their eyes
uninvited guests in their lands

entry.title: Morning Dew
entry.content:
I awaken in a mountain meadow
and find morning dew

frozen and glittering
on every blade of grass

a million tiny diamonds
or a field of fallen stars

in the sunlight they evaporate
returning to the sky

entry.title: Diametric Forces
entry.content:
wintergreen
summer sheen
walk among the roses

old and new
out of view
have forgot what once was

fleeting thought
won't be caught
suffering my choices

feeling seen
in a dream
diametric forces

entry.title: Strawberry Sweet
entry.content:
when summer's starting
and we are eating strawberries
you kiss me
and it is sweet

when rain is pouring
and bed is so inviting
in your arms
I feel complete

when times are trying
and life is falling out of balance
I am glad
that we did meet

when summer's ending
and there are no more strawberries
you kiss me
and it is sweet

entry.title: Mossy Boughs
entry.content:
like green furry fingers
grasping at air
the floor below
thick with dead leaves of the past
and there above
soft green ones emerging

storm
a tree falls
and takes its neighbor with it
seasons later
their children rise to take their place

eons pass
the sun dims and darkens
life slows and ceases
what now?
